snippet: Penn students’ tradition of throwing toast can be traced to an alcohol ban in the 1970s, and it appears to be linked to a scene in “The Rocky Horror Picture Show.”
abstract: Campus Corner; University of Pennsylvania football fans have embraced, since 1970s, unusual custom for cheering on their team; at end of third quarter, when band plays song ending with words 'here's a toast to dear old Penn,' slices of toasted bread fly from the stands and onto the field.
lead_paragraph: Penn students’ tradition of throwing toast can be traced to an alcohol ban in the 1970s, and it appears to be linked to a scene in “The Rocky Horror Picture Show.”

headline.print_headline: A Cherished Custom of School Spirit at Penn, Any Way You Slice It
headline.main: A Cherished Custom at Penn, Any Way You Slice It
